StationInfos.Title: Bruxelles-Midi/Brussel-Zuid (Brussels) train station
StationInfos.Content: Bruxelles-Midi/Brussel-Zuid train station, served by Thalys, Eurostar, TGV®, and ICE trains, is the ideal starting point for your journeys to Germany, France, The Netherlands, Luxembourg and the United Kingdom and connects travellers to the entire Belgian domestic railway network.

StationInfos.Title: Travel and tourist information services
StationInfos.Content: At Bruxelles-Midi/Brussel-Zuid train station, you'll find several information desks for domestic and international travel, as well as an international Thalys info desk and a a Brussels Tourist Office desk.

Parkings.Title: Q-Park "Gare du Midi"
Parkings.Content: Direct access to Brussel-Zuid/Bruxelles-Midi (Brussels) train station. Open 24/7.

StationInfos.Title: Köln Hbf (Cologne) train station
StationInfos.Content: Cologne Central Station is one of the five busiest train stations in Germany and a major rail hub. From Cologne, it is possible to reach most destinations within Germany and depart to Scandinavia, Central and Eastern Europe.

StationInfos.Title: Travel and tourist information services
StationInfos.Content: You can find several info desks at Köln Hbf (Cologne) train station, including central information centres for travel and tourist info and an information centre for domestic and international travel.

Parkings.Title: Parking "Breslauer Platz"
Parkings.Content: Underground car park in front of Cologne train station. Open 24/7.

StationInfos.Title: London St Pancras International train station
StationInfos.Content: London's St Pancras International Station is where major domestic railway lines terminate and Eurostar starts, making this railway station the gateway to Continental Europe. Seamless changes from domestic services to Eurostar means getting the train to France, Belgium, the Netherlands, Germany and Luxembourg is a pleasant, stress-free experience.

StationInfos.Title: Travel and tourist information services
StationInfos.Content: London St Pancras International train station features several information desks, among which you'll find information desks for national and international travel.

Parkings.Title: St Pancras International Parking
Parkings.Content: Car park near London St Pancras International. Open 24/7.

StationInfos.Title: Amsterdam Centraal train station
StationInfos.Content: Amsterdam’s Central Station is a real architectural feat. This 19th century "Renaissance" station is actually built on 9,000 wooden piles, making it a key Amsterdam tourist attraction.

StationInfos.Title: Travel and tourist information services
StationInfos.Content: You can get travel info from several locations at Amsterdam Centraal train station. The Ticket & Service Offices can provide you with info on domestic and international train journeys. The station also features general information desks and an Amsterdam Tourist Office desk.

Parkings.Title: Parking "De Bijenkorf"
Parkings.Content: Car park within 2.8 km from Amsterdam Centraal. Open 24/7.

Parkings.Title: Parking "De Kolk"
Parkings.Content: Car park within 1.5km from Amsterdam Centraal. Open 24/7.

Parkings.Title: Parking "Amsterdam Centre"
Parkings.Content: Car park directly opposite Amsterdam Centraal (4-minute walk). Open 24/7.

StationInfos.Title: Paris Nord train station
StationInfos.Content: Paris Nord railway station has links to Northern France (by TGV® and Intercités trains) as well as to Belgium, the Netherlands, and Germany. Thalys and Eurostar make this station the entry point to Northern Europe for France.

StationInfos.Title: Travel and tourist information services
StationInfos.Content: If you need travel or tourist info, Paris Nord train station has several information desks for national and international travel, as well as a Paris Tourist Office desk.

Parkings.Title: Parking "Gare du Nord"
Parkings.Content: Car park next to the main entrance of Paris Nord train station (1-minute walk). Open 24/7.
